author: bridge-bot
content:
<misilva73> Hi all! 
I am working on an empirical analysis related to the multidimensional gas model. A part of it involves breaking down the gas cost of each opcode into the corresponding resources, i.e., compute, history growth, state growth, address access, block size, bloom topics, and memory. Some opcodes are straightforward; e.g., the ADD opcode only uses compute, so we can assign its full cost of 3 gas units to the compute resource. However, some opcodes use multiple resources, and it is unclear from their gas cost formula how the total cost is distributed among the various resources. I assume these formulas came from summing the estimated costs among the various resources, but I have not found such an analysis.
I summarized the information I gathered in this spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17sL4mPbDZEtDAH2i0eG0YlzT8x4k88Jq3YhyE379m1w/edit?usp=sharing. The yellow rows are my guesses, and the red rows are the ones I am not sure how to split. Does anyone know how to fill in the red rows? Or can you point to the person most likely to know?
Thanks for the help!

author: bridge-bot
content:
<chfast> It simply isn't. These are just arbitrary constants assigned 10 years ago. There is no any deeper meaning to them, no hidden dimensions, etc.

Also the assumption that the current values are fair or correct is wrong. (re @misilva73: Hi all! 
I am working on an empirical analysis related to the multidimensional gas model. A part of it involves breaking down the gas cost of each opcode into the corresponding resources, i.e., compute, history growth, state growth, address access, block size, bloom topics, and memory. Some opcodes are straightforward; e.g., the ADD opcode only uses compute, so we can assign its full cost of 3 gas units to the compute resource. However, some opcodes use multiple resources, and it is unclear from their gas cost formula how the total cost is distributed among the various resources. I assume these formulas came from summing the estimated costs among the various resources, but I have not found such an analysis.
I summarized the information I gathered in this spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17sL4mPbDZEtDAH2i0eG0YlzT8x4k88Jq3YhyE379m1w/edit?usp=sharing. The yellow rows are my guesses, and the red rows are the ones I am not sure how to split. Does anyone know how to fill in the red rows? Or can you point to the person most likely to know?
Thanks for the help!)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<Relyt29> Hi,

I've been working on this exact same problem and I have a doc very similar to this on Offchain Labs's private document platform, I'll dm you separately about how to get you access to what I have written down for the opcodes that use multiple resources, maybe we can collaborate (re @misilva73: Hi all! 
I am working on an empirical analysis related to the multidimensional gas model. A part of it involves breaking down the gas cost of each opcode into the corresponding resources, i.e., compute, history growth, state growth, address access, block size, bloom topics, and memory. author: bridge-bot
content: <davidecrapis> we have room for 1-2 more topics. pls comment in the issue or here if you'd like to be added
